014package org.jdbi.v3.core;
015
016import java.io.Closeable;
017import java.sql.Connection;
018import java.sql.SQLException;
019import java.util.ArrayList;
020import java.util.List;
021
022import javax.annotation.concurrent.GuardedBy;
023
024import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
025import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.Configurable;
026import org.jdbi.v3.core.extension.ExtensionMethod;
027import org.jdbi.v3.core.extension.Extensions;
028import org.jdbi.v3.core.extension.NoSuchExtensionException;
029import org.jdbi.v3.core.result.ResultBearing;
030import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.Batch;
031import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.Call;
032import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.MetaData;
033import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.PreparedBatch;
034import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.Query;
035import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.Script;
036import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.StatementBuilder;
037import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.Update;
038import org.jdbi.v3.core.transaction.TransactionException;
039import org.jdbi.v3.core.transaction.TransactionHandler;
040import org.jdbi.v3.core.transaction.TransactionIsolationLevel;
041import org.jdbi.v3.core.transaction.UnableToManipulateTransactionIsolationLevelException;
042import org.jdbi.v3.meta.Beta;
043import org.slf4j.Logger;
044import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
045
046import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNull;
047import static java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS;
048import static java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS;
049
050/**
051 * This represents a connection to the database system. It is a wrapper around
052 * a JDBC Connection object.  Handle provides essential methods for transaction
053 * management, statement creation, and other operations tied to the database session.
054 */
055public class Handle implements Closeable, Configurable<Handle> {
056    private static final Logger LOG = LoggerFactory.getLogger(Handle.class);
057
058    private final Jdbi jdbi;
059    private final ConnectionCloser closer;
060    private final TransactionHandler transactions;
061    private final Connection connection;
062    private final boolean forceEndTransactions;
063
064    private ThreadLocal<ConfigRegistry> localConfig;
065    private ThreadLocal<ExtensionMethod> localExtensionMethod;
066    private StatementBuilder statementBuilder;
067
068    @GuardedBy("transactionCallbacks")
069    private final List<TransactionCallback> transactionCallbacks = new ArrayList<>();
070
071    private boolean closed = false;
072
073    Handle(Jdbi jdbi,
074           ConfigRegistry localConfig,
075           ConnectionCloser closer,
076           TransactionHandler transactions,
077           StatementBuilder statementBuilder,
078           Connection connection) throws SQLException {
079        this.jdbi = jdbi;
080        this.closer = closer;
081        this.connection = connection;
082
083        this.localConfig = ThreadLocal.withInitial(() -> localConfig);
084        this.localExtensionMethod = new ThreadLocal<>();
085        this.statementBuilder = statementBuilder;
086        this.transactions = transactions.specialize(this);
087        this.forceEndTransactions = !transactions.isInTransaction(this);
088    }
089
090    public Jdbi getJdbi() {
091        return jdbi;
092    }
093
094    @Override
095    public ConfigRegistry getConfig() {
096        return localConfig.get();
097    }
098
099    void setConfig(ConfigRegistry config) {
100        this.localConfig.set(config);
101    }
102
103    void setLocalConfig(ThreadLocal<ConfigRegistry> configThreadLocal) {
104        // Without explicit remove the Tomcats thread-local leak detector gives superfluous warnings
105        this.localConfig.remove();
106        this.localConfig = configThreadLocal;
107    }
108
109    /**
110     * Get the JDBC Connection this Handle uses.
111     *
112     * @return the JDBC Connection this Handle uses
113     */
114    public Connection getConnection() {
115        return this.connection;
116    }
117
118    /**
119     * Returns the current {@link StatementBuilder}.
120     *
121     * @return the current {@link StatementBuilder}
122     */
123    public StatementBuilder getStatementBuilder() {
124        return statementBuilder;
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * Specify the statement builder to use for this handle.
129     * @param builder StatementBuilder to be used
130     * @return this
131     */
132    public Handle setStatementBuilder(StatementBuilder builder) {
133        this.statementBuilder = builder;
134        return this;
135    }
136
137    /**
138     * Closes the handle, its connection, and any other database resources it is holding.
139     *
140     * @throws CloseException if any resources throw exception while closing
141     * @throws TransactionException if called while the handle has a transaction open. The open transaction will be
142     * rolled back.
143     */
144    @Override
145    public void close() {
146        final List<Throwable> suppressed = new ArrayList<>();
147        if (closed) {
148            return;
149        }
150
151        boolean connectionIsLive;
152
153        try {
154            connectionIsLive = !connection.isClosed();
155        } catch (SQLException e) {
156            // if the connection state can not be determined, assume that the
157            // connection is closed and ignore the exception
158            connectionIsLive = false;
159        }
160
161        boolean wasInTransaction = false;
162
163        if (connectionIsLive && forceEndTransactions && localConfig.get().get(Handles.class).isForceEndTransactions()) {
164            try {
165                wasInTransaction = isInTransaction();
166            } catch (Exception e) {
167                suppressed.add(e);
168            }
169        }
170
171        localExtensionMethod.remove();
172        localConfig.remove();
173
174        if (wasInTransaction) {
175            try {
176                rollback();
177            } catch (Exception e) {
178                suppressed.add(e);
179            }
180        }
181
182        if (connectionIsLive) {
183            try {
184                statementBuilder.close(getConnection());
185            } catch (Exception e) {
186                suppressed.add(e);
187            }
188        }
189
190        try {
191            if (connectionIsLive) {
192                closer.close(connection);
193            }
194
195            if (!suppressed.isEmpty()) {
196                final Throwable original = suppressed.remove(0);
197                suppressed.forEach(original::addSuppressed);
198                throw new CloseException("Failed to clear transaction status on close", original);
199            }
200            if (wasInTransaction) {
201                throw new TransactionException("Improper transaction handling detected: A Handle with an open "
202                    + "transaction was closed. Transactions must be explicitly committed or rolled back "
203                    + "before closing the Handle. "
204                    + "Jdbi has rolled back this transaction automatically. "
205                    + "This check may be disabled by calling getConfig(Handles.class).setForceEndTransactions(false).");
206            }
207        } catch (SQLException e) {
208            CloseException ce = new CloseException("Unable to close Connection", e);
209            suppressed.forEach(ce::addSuppressed);
210            throw ce;
211        } finally {
212            LOG.trace("Handle [{}] released", this);
213            closed = true;
214        }
215    }
216
217    /**
218     * Returns true if the {@link Handle} has been closed.
219     *
220     * @return True if the Handle is closed.
221     */
222    public boolean isClosed() {
223        return closed;
224    }
225
226    /**
227     * Convenience method which creates a query with the given positional arguments
228     * @param sql SQL or named statement
229     * @param args arguments to bind positionally
230     * @return query object
231     */
232    public Query select(CharSequence sql, Object... args) {
233        Query query = this.createQuery(sql);
234        int position = 0;
235        for (Object arg : args) {
236            query.bind(position++, arg);
237        }
238        return query;
239    }
240
241    /**
242     * Deprecated delegate - please use {@code CharSequence} signature for future compatibility.
243     */
244    public Query select(String sql, Object... args) {
245        return select((CharSequence) sql, args);
246    }
247
248    /**
249     * Execute a SQL statement, and return the number of rows affected by the statement.
250     *
251     * @param sql the SQL statement to execute, using positional parameters (if any)
252     * @param args positional arguments
253     *
254     * @return the number of rows affected
255     */
256    public int execute(CharSequence sql, Object... args) {
257        try (Update stmt = createUpdate(sql)) {
258            int position = 0;
259            for (Object arg : args) {
260                stmt.bind(position++, arg);
261            }
262            return stmt.execute();
263        }
264    }
265
266    /**
267     * Deprecated delegate - please use {@code CharSequence} signature for future compatibility.
268     */
269    public int execute(String sql, Object... args) {
270        return execute((CharSequence) sql, args);
271    }
272
273    /**
274     * Create a non-prepared (no bound parameters, but different SQL) batch statement.
275     * @return empty batch
276     * @see Handle#prepareBatch(String)
277     */
278    public Batch createBatch() {
279        return new Batch(this);
280    }
281
282    /**
283     * Prepare a batch to execute. This is for efficiently executing more than one
284     * of the same statements with different parameters bound.
285     *
286     * @param sql the batch SQL
287     * @return a batch which can have "statements" added
288     */
289    public PreparedBatch prepareBatch(CharSequence sql) {
290        return new PreparedBatch(this, sql);
291    }
292
293    /**
294     * Deprecated delegate - please use {@code CharSequence} signature for future compatibility.
295     */
296    public PreparedBatch prepareBatch(String sql) {
297        return prepareBatch((CharSequence) sql);
298    }
299
300    /**
301     * Create a call to a stored procedure.
302     *
303     * @param sql the stored procedure sql
304     *
305     * @return the Call
306     */
307    public Call createCall(CharSequence sql) {
308        return new Call(this, sql);
309    }
310
311    /**
312     * Deprecated delegate - please use {@code CharSequence} signature for future compatibility.
313     */
314    public Call createCall(String sql) {
315        return createCall((CharSequence) sql);
316    }
317
318    /**
319     * Return a Query instance that executes a statement
320     * with bound parameters and maps the result set into Java types.
321     * @param sql SQL that may return results
322     * @return a Query builder
323     */
324    public Query createQuery(CharSequence sql) {
325        return new Query(this, sql);
326    }
327
328    /**
329     * Deprecated delegate - please use {@code CharSequence} signature for future compatibility.
330     */
331    public Query createQuery(String sql) {
332        return createQuery((CharSequence) sql);
333    }
334
335    /**
336     * Creates a Script from the given SQL script.
337     *
338     * @param sql the SQL script
339     *
340     * @return the created Script
341     */
342    public Script createScript(CharSequence sql) {
343        return new Script(this, sql);
344    }
345
346    /**
347     * Deprecated delegate - please use {@code CharSequence} signature for future compatibility.
348     */
349    public Script createScript(String sql) {
350        return createScript((CharSequence) sql);
351    }
352
353    /**
354     * Create an Insert or Update statement which returns the number of rows modified.
355     *
356     * @param sql the statement sql
357     *
358     * @return the Update builder
359     */
360    public Update createUpdate(CharSequence sql) {
361        return new Update(this, sql);
362    }
363
364    /**
365     * Deprecated delegate - please use {@code CharSequence} signature for future compatibility.
366     */
367    public Update createUpdate(String sql) {
368        return createUpdate((CharSequence) sql);
369    }
370
371    /**
372     * Access database metadata that returns a {@link java.sql.ResultSet}. All methods of {@link org.jdbi.v3.core.result.ResultBearing} can be used to format
373     * and map the returned results.
374     *
375     * <pre>
376     *     List&lt;String&gt; catalogs = h.queryMetadata(DatabaseMetaData::getCatalogs)
377     *                                      .mapTo(String.class)
378     *                                      .list();
379     * </pre>
380     * <p>
381     * returns the list of catalogs from the current database.
382     *
383     * @param metadataFunction Maps the provided {@link java.sql.DatabaseMetaData} object onto a {@link java.sql.ResultSet} object.
384     * @return The metadata builder.
385     */
386    public ResultBearing queryMetadata(MetaData.MetaDataResultSetProvider metadataFunction) {
387        return new MetaData(this, metadataFunction);
388    }
389
390    /**
391     * Access all database metadata that returns simple values.
392     *
393     * <pre>
394     *     boolean supportsTransactions = handle.queryMetadata(DatabaseMetaData::supportsTransactions);
395     * </pre>
396     *
397     * @param metadataFunction Maps the provided {@link java.sql.DatabaseMetaData} object to a response object.
398     * @return The response object.
399     */
400    public <T> T queryMetadata(MetaData.MetaDataValueProvider<T> metadataFunction) {
401        return new MetaData(this, metadataFunction).execute();
402    }
403
404    /**
405     * Returns whether the handle is in a transaction. Delegates to the underlying {@link TransactionHandler}.
406     *
407     * @return True if the handle is in a transaction.
408     */
409    public boolean isInTransaction() {
410        return transactions.isInTransaction(this);
411    }
412
413    /**
414     * Start a transaction.
415     *
416     * @return the same handle
417     */
418    public Handle begin() {
419        transactions.begin(this);
420        LOG.trace("Handle [{}] begin transaction", this);
421        return this;
422    }
423
424    /**
425     * Commit a transaction.
426     *
427     * @return the same handle
428     */
429    public Handle commit() {
430        final long start = System.nanoTime();
431        transactions.commit(this);
432        LOG.trace("Handle [{}] commit transaction in {}ms", this, msSince(start));
433        drainCallbacks()
434                .forEach(TransactionCallback::afterCommit);
435        return this;
436    }
437
438    /**
439     * Rollback a transaction.
440     *
441     * @return the same handle
442     */
443    public Handle rollback() {
444        final long start = System.nanoTime();
445        transactions.rollback(this);
446        LOG.trace("Handle [{}] rollback transaction in {}ms", this, msSince(start));
447        drainCallbacks()
448                .forEach(TransactionCallback::afterRollback);
449        return this;
450    }
451
452    /**
453     * Execute an action the next time this Handle commits, unless it is rolled back first.
454     * @param afterCommit the action to execute after commit
455     * @return this Handle
456     */
457    @Beta
458    public Handle afterCommit(Runnable afterCommit) {
459        return addTransactionCallback(new TransactionCallback() {
460            @Override
461            public void afterCommit() {
462                afterCommit.run();
463            }
464        });
465    }
466
467    /**
468     * Execute an action the next time this Handle rolls back, unless it is committed first.
469     * @param afterRollback the action to execute after rollback
470     * @return this Handle
471     */
472    @Beta
473    public Handle afterRollback(Runnable afterRollback) {
474       return addTransactionCallback(new TransactionCallback() {
475            @Override
476            public void afterRollback() {
477                afterRollback.run();
478            }
479        });
480    }
481
482    List<TransactionCallback> drainCallbacks() {
483        synchronized (transactionCallbacks) {
484            List<TransactionCallback> result = new ArrayList<>(transactionCallbacks);
485            transactionCallbacks.clear();
486            return result;
487        }
488    }
489
490    Handle addTransactionCallback(TransactionCallback cb) {
491        if (!isInTransaction()) {
492            throw new IllegalStateException("Handle must be in transaction");
493        }
494        synchronized (transactionCallbacks) {
495            transactionCallbacks.add(cb);
496        }
497        return this;
498    }
499
500    /**
501     * Rollback a transaction to a named savepoint.
502     *
503     * @param savepointName the name of the savepoint, previously declared with {@link Handle#savepoint}
504     *
505     * @return the same handle
506     */
507    public Handle rollbackToSavepoint(String savepointName) {
508        final long start = System.nanoTime();
509        transactions.rollbackToSavepoint(this, savepointName);
510        LOG.trace("Handle [{}] rollback to savepoint \"{}\" in {}ms", this, savepointName, msSince(start));
511        return this;
512    }
513
514    private static long msSince(final long start) {
515        return MILLISECONDS.convert(System.nanoTime() - start, NANOSECONDS);
516    }
517
518    /**
519     * Create a transaction savepoint with the name provided.
520     *
521     * @param name The name of the savepoint
522     * @return The same handle
523     */
524    public Handle savepoint(String name) {
525        transactions.savepoint(this, name);
526        LOG.trace("Handle [{}] savepoint \"{}\"", this, name);
527        return this;
528    }
529
530    /**
531     * Release a previously created savepoint.
532     *
533     * @param savepointName the name of the savepoint to release
534     * @return the same handle
535     */
536    public Handle release(String savepointName) {
537        transactions.releaseSavepoint(this, savepointName);
538        LOG.trace("Handle [{}] release savepoint \"{}\"", this, savepointName);
539        return this;
540    }
541
542    /**
543     * Whether the connection is in read-only mode.
544     *
545     * @return True if the connection is in read-only mode.
546     * @see Connection#isReadOnly()
547     */
548    public boolean isReadOnly() {
549        try {
550            return connection.isReadOnly();
551        } catch (SQLException e) {
552            throw new UnableToManipulateTransactionIsolationLevelException("Could not getReadOnly", e);
553        }
554    }
555
556    /**
557     * Set the Handle readOnly.
558     * This acts as a hint to the database to improve performance or concurrency.
559     *
560     * May not be called in an active transaction!
561     *
562     * @see Connection#setReadOnly(boolean)
563     * @param readOnly whether the Handle is readOnly
564     * @return this Handle
565     */
566    public Handle setReadOnly(boolean readOnly) {
567        try {
568            connection.setReadOnly(readOnly);
569        } catch (SQLException e) {
570            throw new UnableToManipulateTransactionIsolationLevelException("Could not setReadOnly", e);
571        }
572        return this;
573    }
574
575    /**
576     * Executes <code>callback</code> in a transaction, and returns the result of the callback.
577     *
578     * @param callback a callback which will receive an open handle, in a transaction.
579     * @param <R> type returned by callback
580     * @param <X> exception type thrown by the callback, if any
581     *
582     * @return value returned from the callback
583     *
584     * @throws X any exception thrown by the callback
585     */
586    public <R, X extends Exception> R inTransaction(HandleCallback<R, X> callback) throws X {
587        return isInTransaction()
588            ? callback.withHandle(this)
589            : transactions.inTransaction(this, callback);
590    }
591
592    /**
593     * Executes <code>callback</code> in a transaction.
594     *
595     * @param consumer a callback which will receive an open handle, in a transaction.
596     * @param <X> exception type thrown by the callback, if any
597     *
598     * @throws X any exception thrown by the callback
599     */
600    public <X extends Exception> void useTransaction(final HandleConsumer<X> consumer) throws X {
601        inTransaction(consumer.asCallback());
602    }
603
604    /**
605     * Executes <code>callback</code> in a transaction, and returns the result of the callback.
606     *
607     * <p>
608     * This form accepts a transaction isolation level which will be applied to the connection
609     * for the scope of this transaction, after which the original isolation level will be restored.
610     * </p>
611     * @param level the transaction isolation level which will be applied to the connection for the scope of this
612     *              transaction, after which the original isolation level will be restored.
613     * @param callback a callback which will receive an open handle, in a transaction.
614     * @param <R> type returned by callback
615     * @param <X> exception type thrown by the callback, if any
616     *
617     * @return value returned from the callback
618     *
619     * @throws X any exception thrown by the callback
620     */
621    public <R, X extends Exception> R inTransaction(TransactionIsolationLevel level, HandleCallback<R, X> callback) throws X {
622        if (isInTransaction()) {
623            TransactionIsolationLevel currentLevel = getTransactionIsolationLevel();
624            if (currentLevel != level && level != TransactionIsolationLevel.UNKNOWN) {
625                throw new TransactionException(
626                    "Tried to execute nested transaction with isolation level " + level + ", "
627                    + "but already running in a transaction with isolation level " + currentLevel + ".");
628            }
629            return callback.withHandle(this);
630        }
631
632        try (TransactionResetter tr = new TransactionResetter(getTransactionIsolationLevel())) {
633            setTransactionIsolation(level);
634            return transactions.inTransaction(this, level, callback);
635        }
636    }
637
638    /**
639     * Executes <code>callback</code> in a transaction.
640     *
641     * <p>
642     * This form accepts a transaction isolation level which will be applied to the connection
643     * for the scope of this transaction, after which the original isolation level will be restored.
644     * </p>
645     * @param level the transaction isolation level which will be applied to the connection for the scope of this
646     *              transaction, after which the original isolation level will be restored.
647     * @param consumer a callback which will receive an open handle, in a transaction.
648     * @param <X> exception type thrown by the callback, if any
649     * @throws X any exception thrown by the callback
650     */
651    public <X extends Exception> void useTransaction(TransactionIsolationLevel level, HandleConsumer<X> consumer) throws X {
652        inTransaction(level, consumer.asCallback());
653    }
654
655    /**
656     * Set the transaction isolation level on the underlying connection.
657     *
658     * @throws UnableToManipulateTransactionIsolationLevelException if isolation level is not supported by the underlying connection or JDBC driver
659     *
660     * @param level the isolation level to use
661     */
662    public void setTransactionIsolation(TransactionIsolationLevel level) {
663        if (level != TransactionIsolationLevel.UNKNOWN) {
664            setTransactionIsolation(level.intValue());
665        }
666    }
667
668    /**
669     * Set the transaction isolation level on the underlying connection.
670     *
671     * @param level the isolation level to use
672     */
673    public void setTransactionIsolation(int level) {
674        try {
675            if (connection.getTransactionIsolation() != level) {
676                connection.setTransactionIsolation(level);
677            }
678        } catch (SQLException e) {
679            throw new UnableToManipulateTransactionIsolationLevelException(level, e);
680        }
681    }
682
683    /**
684     * Obtain the current transaction isolation level.
685     *
686     * @return the current isolation level on the underlying connection
687     */
688    public TransactionIsolationLevel getTransactionIsolationLevel() {
689        try {
690            return TransactionIsolationLevel.valueOf(connection.getTransactionIsolation());
691        } catch (SQLException e) {
692            throw new UnableToManipulateTransactionIsolationLevelException("unable to access current setting", e);
693        }
694    }
695
696    /**
697     * Create a Jdbi extension object of the specified type bound to this handle. The returned extension's lifecycle is
698     * coupled to the lifecycle of this handle. Closing the handle will render the extension unusable.
699     *
700     * @param extensionType the extension class
701     * @param <T> the extension type
702     * @return the new extension object bound to this handle
703     */
704    public <T> T attach(Class<T> extensionType) {
705        return getConfig(Extensions.class)
706                .findFor(extensionType, ConstantHandleSupplier.of(this))
707                .orElseThrow(() -> new NoSuchExtensionException(extensionType));
708    }
709
710    /**
711     * Returns the extension method currently bound to the handle's context.
712     *
713     * @return the extension method currently bound to the handle's context
714     */
715    public ExtensionMethod getExtensionMethod() {
716        return localExtensionMethod.get();
717    }
718
719    void setExtensionMethod(ExtensionMethod extensionMethod) {
720        this.localExtensionMethod.set(extensionMethod);
721    }
722
723    void setExtensionMethodThreadLocal(ThreadLocal<ExtensionMethod> extensionMethodThreadLocal) {
724        this.localExtensionMethod = requireNonNull(extensionMethodThreadLocal);
725    }
726
727    interface ConnectionCloser {
728        void close(Connection conn) throws SQLException;
729    }
730
731    private class TransactionResetter implements Closeable {
732
733        private final TransactionIsolationLevel initial;
734
735        TransactionResetter(TransactionIsolationLevel initial) {
736            this.initial = initial;
737        }
738
739        @Override
740        public void close() {
741            setTransactionIsolation(initial);
742        }
743    }
744}
